tr_desc: language to display the application in
automatically start in 'use' mode
the app minimizes itself at start
{NAME} hides itself in use mode, so it's possible to keep it at the top, [color=FF0000FF]please see the full documentation for the use case and effects of this setting[/color]
automatically save current profile on exit
Ask for confirmation before exiting

'primary' will display the window fullscreen on the primary display, 'all' will extend to cover all the available screens automatically, this assumes all your displayed are covered by your touch provider, make sure to adjust 'screen width' and 'screen height' values in the 'Detection' section when using 'all'
verbose tuio send updates about moving touches
destination ip to send tuio events to

destination port to send tuio events to, you can use multiple values, separated by commas (e.g: 3337,3338), or express a range, using a minus sign (e.g 3337-3340), or mix both (e.g: 3337-3350,3389), unparsable values will be reset to default
How often to flush the queue of tuio events, (in ms between two flush event)
width of the capture screen
height of the capture screen
surface that is tolerated as a difference from calibration
angle that is tolerated as a difference from calibration
number of different values to use for the post-calibration average
Display currently detected touches
Show matching scores for combinations of touches
Remove matching scores of matched objects, disable to see why an object was matched to the set of points
when a detected object goes outside of the zones, undetect it
Keep missing touches in center/angle computations

tr_title: Keep angle when object is incomplete
tr_desc: If the object has lost one or more touches, and is not yet fixed, only update position, not angle
Keep lost objects for this number of milli-seconds, allowing the software to find them again without lost/find events
The number of tests one have to do for a training
Interval betwen detection of object is dynamic, this is the smallest interval between two detections.
When enabled, {NAME} will try to prevent sudden angle changes, that may come from misdetection
ignore sudden rotations bigger than this threshold value
time to retain the touch for
max distance to consider new touch is the old one

tr_title: minimum duration of a touch before considering it
tr_desc: wait for this time before propagating new touch events, introduce this delay in all touches

tr_title: maximum speed of a new touch befored discarding it
tr_desc: while a touch being checked for duration, if its speed goes over this limit, discard it
